normalised: social media and influencer marketing news: are your insta followers actually real?

unnormalised: **Social Media & Influencer Marketing News: Are Your Insta Followers Actually Real?**
normalised: Mumbai: ever wondered if half your followers are just bots sipping chai and watching cricket highlights? new follower analytics tools are popping up faster than Ganpati pandals, promising to reveal the truth behind those follower counts.

unnormalised: Mumbai: Ever wondered if half your followers are just bots sipping chai and watching cricket highlights? New follower analytics tools are popping up faster than Ganpati pandals, promising to reveal the truth behind those follower counts.
normalised: Doctor Sharma from I I M Ahmedabad says these tools use sophisticated algorithms to identify fake accounts and inactive users. apparently, some influencers in Delhi are losing sleep as their inflated follower counts crumble faster than a vada pav in monsoon.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma from IIM Ahmedabad says these tools use sophisticated algorithms to identify fake accounts and inactive users. Apparently, some influencers in Delhi are losing sleep as their inflated follower counts crumble faster than a vada pav in monsoon.
normalised: the hype? brands are wising up, demanding proof of genuine engagement before shelling out rupees fifty thousand plus for sponsored posts. one tool even maps the geographical location of your followers – turns out, some "Indian" followers are suspiciously located in a ten square feet server room in Vladivostok!

normalised: expect to see more transparency and maybe some awkward apologies in the influencer marketing space. it's time to ditch the fake followers and focus on building real connections. after all, authentic engagement is more valuable than a million robotic "Jai Hinds."
